channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large pile of litter, 23rd September
item.description:
I’ve reported this On Monday and got a notification this has been resolved today. However the rubbish is still here. Can you please take away as it’s right putside Jubilee Primary School. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More Flytipping along Clapton Passage, 23rd September
item.description:
Once again someone has dumped a load of rubbish outisde the entrance gate to our flats . It appears to be boxes and rubbish bags and household waste. Would it please be possible to put a No Flytipping sign up? This seems to happen all the time.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Passage, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken manhole cover on pavement, 23rd September
item.description:
This needs fixing asap as it’s an accident waiting to happen if somebody falls in and breaks their leg. Currently covered ad hoc by a crate! Please treat as urgent
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Way, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign broken, one half knocked out of place, 23rd September
item.description:
It looks like something has hit this road sign. It’s broken in two and half of it has swung round and is no longer easily readable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Claremont Road, Golders Green, London

item.title: Empty home w, 23rd September
item.description:
This problem has been here for 2 years and is spilling out onto the public footpath. I have reported this multiple times. Large items of household waste and general smaller rubbish are being placed in this back garden, which I have seen encourage cats, mice & even rats to take home in this property which is extremely concerning. Fence of the property is falling down at the back creating a hazard on the public footpath.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, Bournemouth Close, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Width restriction bollard has been removed, 23rd September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, London

item.title: Wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 91 Fernhead Road., 23rd September
item.description:
Wet dog fouling on the pavement which is in front of 91 Fernhead. The fouling is in the middle of the pavement. And is also not far from the big tree which is on the corner of Fernhead Road and Fordingley Road. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London

item.description:

item.title: Construction site gravel spillage blocking footpath., 23rd September
item.description:
A delivery of gravel for the site appears to have been unloaded outside of the site boundary and onto the pavement, blocking the pavement for pedestrians. No site workers present to ask what is being done about it and no warning signage displayed either.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pellerin Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 23rd September
item.description:
Van abandoned for more than 10 weeks now. Been reported twice. Has no MOT but taxed until Feb. Last time Council said the van 'has no registered keeper' so is being passed to DVLA. I have today spoken to them and they said this information is wrong and it should be handled by the Council. The doors are open and locks have been broken into. I am to call them back if you have more explanation .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Boundary Road, Falconwood, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
